name: length
content:
length noun
(DISTANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ C or U ] the measurement of something from end to end or along its longest side: The boat is ten metres in length. The length of the bay is approximately 200 miles. She planted rose bushes (along) the length of the fence (= the whole distance along it).
[ C ] a piece of something such as string or pipe: a length of rope
[ C ] a unit used in describing the distance by which a horse or boat wins a race, equal to the measurement from one end of the horse or boat to the other: We won by two lengths.
[ C ] the distance from one end of a swimming pool to the other: She swims 40 lengths a day.
[ C or U ]
  sports
  specialized in cricket, the distance that the ball travels before it bounces after it has been bowled (= thrown to the batter): He needs to bring his length back a bit as he's getting driven too much. I was deceived by the length of the delivery which was much fuller than I had expected.
More examplesFewer examplesThe impact of the crash reduced the car to a third of its original length.Application forms vary greatly in layout and length.The metre is the standard unit for measuring length in the SI system.The mountains stretch the entire length of the country.Dad, I swam a whole length of the pool underwater !

length noun
(TIME)
B2 [ C ] the amount of time something lasts: the length of a film/speech/play He is unable to concentrate on his work for any length of time (= for anything more than a short time). Synonym
duration
C1 [ C or U ] the amount of writing in a book or document: He's written books of various lengths on the subject. All of your essays will be about the same length. at length
C2 for a long time: George went on at great length about his various illnesses.
formal If something happens at length, it happens after a long period of time: At length, the authorities allowed her to go home.
